member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.EmotionalArcs
member.summary:
Emotional arc patterns based on Kurt Vonnegut's "Shapes of Stories" and computational story analysis research.
Each arc defines a characteristic trajectory of fortune/valence through a story's timeline.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.EmotionalArcs.RagsToRiches
member.summary: Rags to Riches - steady rise from misfortune to happiness. Examples: Cinderella, Great Expectations, Jane Eyre.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.EmotionalArcs.RichesToRags
member.summary: Riches to Rags - steady decline from happiness to misfortune. Examples: Romeo and Juliet, The Great Gatsby, Oedipus Rex.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.EmotionalArcs.ManInHole
member.summary: Man in a Hole - fall then rise. Most common arc in fiction. Examples: The Hobbit, Finding Nemo, most action movies.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.EmotionalArcs.Icarus
member.summary: Icarus - rise then fall. Classic tragedy pattern. Examples: Macbeth, Breaking Bad, The Wolf of Wall Street.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.EmotionalArcs.Cinderella
member.summary: Cinderella - rise, fall, rise. Extended version of Man in Hole. Examples: Cinderella, Pretty Woman, The Pursuit of Happyness.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.EmotionalArcs.Oedipus
member.summary: Oedipus - fall, rise, fall. Double tragedy. Examples: Oedipus Rex, Hamlet, many noir films.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.EmotionalArcs.All
member.summary: All defined emotional arcs.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.EmotionalArcs.GetByCode(System.String)
member.summary: Gets an arc by its code.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.EmotionalArcs.GetByArchetype(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.ArcArchetype)
member.summary: Gets arcs matching a specific archetype.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.EmotionalArcs.FindBestMatch(System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{System.Double})
member.summary: Finds the best-matching arc for a given trajectory. Uses least squares distance to compare trajectories.
member.returns: The best-matching arc and its fit score (0-1, higher is better).

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.EmotionalArcs.CalculateTrajectoryDistance(System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{System.Double},System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{System.Double})
member.summary: Calculate RMSE between two trajectories, interpolating if lengths differ.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.EmotionalArc
member.summary: Represents an emotional arc pattern.
member.param: Normalized trajectory points (0-1), evenly spaced through story.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.EmotionalArc.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{System.Double},BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.ArcArchetype)
member.summary: Represents an emotional arc pattern.
member.param: Normalized trajectory points (0-1), evenly spaced through story.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.EmotionalArc.Code
member.summary: Unique identifier for the arc.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.EmotionalArc.Name
member.summary: Display name.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.EmotionalArc.Description
member.summary: Human-readable description.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.EmotionalArc.Trajectory
member.summary: Normalized trajectory points (0-1), evenly spaced through story.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.EmotionalArc.Archetype
member.summary: The basic shape category.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.EmotionalArc.GetFortuneAt(System.Double)
member.summary: Gets the expected fortune value at a given story position.
member.returns: Expected fortune value (0-1).

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.EmotionalArc.EndsPositive
member.summary: Gets whether this arc ends positively (fortune greater than 0.5).

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.EmotionalArc.EndsNegative
member.summary: Gets whether this arc ends negatively (fortune less than 0.5).

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.EmotionalArc.Range
member.summary: Gets the overall range of the arc (max - min).

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.ArcArchetype
member.summary: Basic shape categories for emotional arcs.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.ArcArchetype.Rise
member.summary: Steady rise from low to high.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.ArcArchetype.Fall
member.summary: Steady fall from high to low.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.ArcArchetype.FallRise
member.summary: Fall then rise (most common).

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.ArcArchetype.RiseFall
member.summary: Rise then fall (tragedy).

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.ArcArchetype.RiseFallRise
member.summary: Rise, fall, then rise again.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.ArcArchetype.FallRiseFall
member.summary: Fall, rise, then fall again.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Characters.PersonalityTraits
member.summary:
Personality trait axes for character behavior modeling. Based on the Five Factor Model (Big Five) with extensions for narrative-relevant dimensions.
All traits are bipolar axes from -1.0 to +1.0.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Characters.PersonalityTraits.Confrontational
member.summary: Confrontational vs Pacifist axis. -1.0 = Avoids conflict at all costs. +1.0 = Seeks confrontation.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Characters.PersonalityTraits.Trusting
member.summary: Trusting vs Suspicious axis. -1.0 = Deeply suspicious of everyone. +1.0 = Trusts easily, perhaps naively.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Characters.PersonalityTraits.Reckless
member.summary: Reckless vs Cautious axis. -1.0 = Extremely cautious, risk-averse. +1.0 = Reckless, thrill-seeking.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Characters.PersonalityTraits.Loyal
member.summary: Loyal vs Self-Serving axis. -1.0 = Completely self-interested. +1.0 = Intensely loyal to group/cause.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Characters.PersonalityTraits.Curious
member.summary: Curious vs Incurious axis. -1.0 = Disinterested in learning. +1.0 = Intensely curious about everything.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Characters.PersonalityTraits.Merciful
member.summary: Merciful vs Ruthless axis. -1.0 = Completely ruthless. +1.0 = Always shows mercy.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Characters.PersonalityTraits.Ambitious
member.summary: Ambitious vs Content axis. -1.0 = Content with current status. +1.0 = Intensely driven to advance.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Characters.PersonalityTraits.Stoic
member.summary: Stoic vs Expressive axis. -1.0 = Highly expressive emotionally. +1.0 = Stoic, hides emotions.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Characters.PersonalityTraits.All
member.summary: All defined personality traits.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Characters.PersonalityTraits.GetByCode(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a trait by its code.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Characters.PersonalityTraits.GetLabel(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Characters.PersonalityTrait,System.Double)
member.summary: Gets the descriptive label for a trait value.
member.returns: Human-readable description of this trait level.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Characters.PersonalityTrait
member.summary: Represents a personality trait axis.
member.param: How this trait affects NPC behavior.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Characters.PersonalityTrait.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Represents a personality trait axis.
member.param: How this trait affects NPC behavior.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Characters.PersonalityTrait.Code
member.summary: Unique identifier for the trait.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Characters.PersonalityTrait.Name
member.summary: Display name (typically the positive pole).

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Characters.PersonalityTrait.NegativePole
member.summary: Label for -1.0 end of axis.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Characters.PersonalityTrait.PositivePole
member.summary: Label for +1.0 end of axis.

member.summary: What this trait measures.

member.summary: How this trait affects NPC behavior.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Characters.PersonalityTrait.GetLabel(System.Double)
member.summary: Gets the label for a specific value on this trait axis.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Characters.PersonalityTrait.GetPolarity(System.Double)
member.summary: Gets which pole a value leans toward.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Characters.PersonalityArchetypes
member.summary: Common personality archetypes composed of trait combinations.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Characters.PersonalityArchetypes.Hero
member.summary: The Hero - brave, loyal, merciful.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Characters.PersonalityArchetypes.Villain
member.summary: The Villain - ruthless, ambitious, suspicious.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Characters.PersonalityArchetypes.Mentor
member.summary: The Mentor - wise, cautious, loyal.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Characters.PersonalityArchetypes.Trickster
member.summary: The Trickster - curious, reckless, self-serving.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Characters.PersonalityArchetypes.Guardian
member.summary: The Guardian - loyal, cautious, stoic.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Characters.PersonalityArchetypes.All
member.summary: All defined archetypes.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Characters.PersonalityArchetypes.FindClosest(System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyDictionary{System.String,System.Double})
member.summary: Finds the closest archetype to a given trait set.
member.param: Trait values keyed by trait code.
member.returns: Archetype name and similarity score (0-1).

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Characters.PersonalityArchetypes.CalculateSimilarity(System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyDictionary{System.String,System.Double},System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyDictionary{System.String,System.Double})
member.summary: Calculate cosine similarity between trait sets.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Elements.NarrativePhase
member.summary: Narrative phases based on Propp's morphological analysis. These represent the major structural divisions of a narrative.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Elements.NarrativePhase.Preparation
member.summary: Initial situation and setup (Propp functions 1-7). Establishes the world, characters, and initial state.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Elements.NarrativePhase.Complication
member.summary: Problem establishment (Propp functions 8-11). Introduces the villainy or lack that drives the story.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Elements.NarrativePhase.Donor
member.summary: Helper acquisition (Propp functions 12-15). Hero gains magical agent or assistance.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Elements.NarrativePhase.Transference
member.summary: Transition to confrontation (Propp function 16). Hero is transported to the location of conflict.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Elements.NarrativePhase.Struggle
member.summary: Direct conflict (Propp functions 17-19). Combat, victory, and resolution of the initial problem.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Elements.NarrativePhase.Return
member.summary: Resolution and aftermath (Propp functions 20-31). Hero returns, is recognized, and receives reward.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Elements.NarrativePhaseExtensions
member.summary: Extension methods for NarrativePhase.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Elements.NarrativePhaseExtensions.GetSignificance(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Elements.NarrativePhase)
member.summary: Gets the significance weight for a narrative phase.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Elements.NarrativePhaseExtensions.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Parses a phase name to the enum value.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Elements.NarrativePhaseExtensions.TryParse(System.String,BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Elements.NarrativePhase@)
member.summary: Tries to parse a phase name.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Elements.ProppFunctions
member.summary: Vladimir Propp's 31 narrative functions from Morphology of the Folktale (1928). Functions represent actions that advance the plot, occurring in a fixed sequential order.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Elements.ProppFunctions.GetPhaseSignificance(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the narrative significance of a function based on its phase. Higher significance indicates more essential story beats.
member.param: The narrative phase (preparation, complication, donor, transference, struggle, return).
member.returns: Significance score (0.0-1.0).
member.remarks: Phase weights rationale: - Struggle/Return (0.9): Story climax and resolution - essential beats - Complication (0.8): Problem establishment - mandatory (Villainy or Lack required) - Transference (0.7): Bridge to conflict - transformation point - Donor (0.6): Helper acquisition - enables resolution - Preparation (0.4): Setup functions - often optional in shorter narratives

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Elements.ProppFunctions.GetPhaseForFunction(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the phase for a function by its code.
member.returns: The phase name, or "unknown" if not found.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Elements.ProppFunctions.GetFunctionSignificance(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the significance for a function by its code.
member.returns: Significance score (0.0-1.0).

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Elements.ProppFunctions.IsMandatory(System.String)
member.summary: Checks if a function is mandatory for a complete narrative.
member.returns: True if the function is required for narrative completeness.
member.remarks: Per Propp, a tale must have either Villainy (A) or Lack (a) to initiate the complication. Liquidation (K) or its equivalent resolves the narrative problem.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Elements.ProppFunctions.All
member.summary: All 31 Propp functions with their symbols, names, and phases.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Elements.ProppFunctions.GetByCode(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a function by its code.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Elements.ProppFunctions.GetBySymbol(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a function by its symbol.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Elements.ProppFunctions.GetByPhase(System.String)
member.summary: Gets all functions in a specific phase.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Elements.ProppFunction
member.summary: Represents a single Propp narrative function.
member.param: Narrative phase (preparation, complication, donor, transference, struggle, return).
Brief description of the function's narrative role.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Elements.ProppFunction.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Represents a single Propp narrative function.
member.param: Narrative phase (preparation, complication, donor, transference, struggle, return).
Brief description of the function's narrative role.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Elements.ProppFunction.Code
member.summary: Unique lowercase identifier (e.g., "villainy", "departure").

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Elements.ProppFunction.Symbol
member.summary: Propp's original symbol (e.g., "A", "↑", "β").

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Elements.ProppFunction.Name
member.summary: Human-readable name.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Elements.ProppFunction.Phase
member.summary: Narrative phase (preparation, complication, donor, transference, struggle, return).

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Elements.ProppFunction.Description
member.summary: Brief description of the function's narrative role.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Elements.ProppFunction.Significance
member.summary: Gets the significance score for this function based on its phase.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Elements.ProppFunction.IsMandatory
member.summary: Gets whether this function is mandatory for a complete narrative.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Genre.CoreValue
member.summary: Core values at stake in Story Grid genres. Each genre centers on a specific value spectrum that drives the narrative.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Genre.CoreValue.Life
member.summary: Life vs Death - Action, Thriller, Horror genres.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Genre.CoreValue.Justice
member.summary: Justice vs Injustice - Crime, Legal genres.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Genre.CoreValue.Love
member.summary: Love vs Hate - Romance, Buddy Love genres.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Genre.CoreValue.Success
member.summary: Success vs Failure - Status, Performance genres.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Genre.CoreValue.Worldview
member.summary: Sophistication vs Naivete - Worldview (Coming of Age) genre.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Genre.CoreValue.Morality
member.summary: Altruism vs Selfishness - Morality genre.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Genre.CoreValue.Honor
member.summary: Honor vs Dishonor - War genre.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Genre.CoreValue.Freedom
member.summary: Freedom vs Subjugation - Society genre.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Genre.CoreValue.Truth
member.summary: Truth vs Deception - Mystery genre.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Genre.ValueSpectrum
member.summary: Represents a value spectrum with positive, negative, and negation-of-negation states.
member.param: The positive end of the spectrum (e.g., "Life").
member.remarks:
Story Grid's value spectrum includes a "negation of the negation" - a state worse than the simple negative. For example, in Thriller: - Positive: Life - Negative: Death - Negation of Negation: Damnation (a fate worse than death)
The negation of negation represents the ultimate stakes and often appears at the "All Is Lost" moment.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Genre.ValueSpectrum.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Represents a value spectrum with positive, negative, and negation-of-negation states.
member.param: The positive end of the spectrum (e.g., "Life").
member.remarks:
Story Grid's value spectrum includes a "negation of the negation" - a state worse than the simple negative. For example, in Thriller: - Positive: Life - Negative: Death - Negation of Negation: Damnation (a fate worse than death)
The negation of negation represents the ultimate stakes and often appears at the "All Is Lost" moment.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Genre.ValueSpectrum.Positive
member.summary: The positive end of the spectrum (e.g., "Life").

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Genre.ValueSpectrum.Negative
member.summary: The negative end (e.g., "Death").

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Genre.ValueSpectrum.NegationOfNegation
member.summary: The fate worse than negative (e.g., "Damnation").

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Genre.ValueSpectrum.NormalizePosition(System.Double)
member.summary: Converts a value position (-1 to +1) to a spectrum position. -1.0 = Negation of Negation, 0.0 = Negative, +1.0 = Positive

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Genre.ValueSpectrum.GetLabel(System.Double)
member.summary: Gets the label for a value position on the spectrum.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Genre.ValueSpectrum.CalculateRangeCovered(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates the range covered between two positions.
member.returns: Range as a fraction of the full spectrum (0-1).

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Genre.StoryGridGenres
member.summary: Story Grid genre definitions with obligatory scenes, conventions, and value spectrums. Based on Shawn Coyne's "The Story Grid" (2015).

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Genre.StoryGridGenres.Action
member.summary: Action genre - Life vs Death with external physical conflict.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Genre.StoryGridGenres.Thriller
member.summary: Thriller genre - Life vs Damnation with psychological/existential stakes.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Genre.StoryGridGenres.Horror
member.summary: Horror genre - Life vs Fate Worse Than Death with supernatural/monstrous threat.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Genre.StoryGridGenres.Crime
member.summary: Mystery/Crime genre - Justice vs Injustice with investigation.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Genre.StoryGridGenres.Love
member.summary: Love/Romance genre - Love vs Hate with relationship focus.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Genre.StoryGridGenres.Worldview
member.summary: Worldview genre - Sophistication vs Naivete (coming of age).

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Genre.StoryGridGenres.Morality
member.summary: Morality genre - Altruism vs Selfishness.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Genre.StoryGridGenres.Status
member.summary: Status genre - Success vs Failure.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Genre.StoryGridGenres.All
member.summary: All defined genres.

member.summary: Gets a genre by its code.

member.summary: Represents a complete Story Grid genre definition.
Represents a complete Story Grid genre definition.

member.summary: Checks if a scene code matches the core event for this genre.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Genre.StoryGridGenre.GetObligatoryScene(System.String)
member.summary: Gets an obligatory scene by its code.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Genre.StoryGridGenre.GetConvention(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a convention by its code.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Genre.ObligatoryScene
member.summary: Represents a required scene for a genre.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Genre.ObligatoryScene.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Represents a required scene for a genre.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Genre.GenreConvention
member.summary: Represents an expected convention for a genre.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Genre.GenreConvention.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Represents an expected convention for a genre.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.GenreComplianceScorer
member.summary:
Scores how well a story satisfies its genre contract. Based on Shawn Coyne's Story Grid methodology (2015).
WEIGHT DERIVATION: These weights are design hypotheses based on: - Story Grid's emphasis on obligatory scenes as genre contracts - Convention presence as reader expectation fulfillment - Core event as the defining moment of the genre - Value spectrum range as emotional journey completeness Configurable to allow empirical tuning via A/B testing.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.GenreComplianceScorer.Weights
member.summary: Hypothesis weights for genre compliance scoring. Subject to empirical calibration.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.GenreComplianceScorer.Weights.ObligatoryScenes
member.summary: Weight for obligatory scene completion. Rationale: Obligatory scenes are the genre's contract with the audience.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.GenreComplianceScorer.Weights.Conventions
member.summary: Weight for convention presence. Rationale: Conventions set reader expectations for the genre.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.GenreComplianceScorer.Weights.CoreEvent
member.summary: Weight for core event presence. Rationale: The core event is the defining moment of the genre.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.GenreComplianceScorer.Weights.ValueSpectrum
member.summary: Weight for value spectrum coverage. Rationale: Emotional range defines the genre's impact.
Calculate genre compliance score.
member.param: The target genre to evaluate against.
Codes of obligatory scenes that have been satisfied.
Codes of conventions present in the story.
Whether the genre's core event has occurred.
Minimum position reached on the value spectrum (-1 to +1).
Maximum position reached on the value spectrum (-1 to +1).
member.returns: Compliance score (0-1). Higher scores indicate better genre fit.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.GenreComplianceScorer.CalculateObligatorySceneScore(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Genre.StoryGridGenre,System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyCollection{System.String})
member.summary: Calculate obligatory scene completion with importance weighting. More important scenes contribute more to the score.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.GenreComplianceScorer.CalculateConventionScore(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Genre.StoryGridGenre,System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyCollection{System.String})
member.summary: Calculate convention presence score.
Evaluates compliance for multiple genres (hybrid stories). Returns the weighted average based on genre blend ratios.
member.param: Genre and its weight in the blend (weights should sum to 1).
Codes of core events that have been satisfied.
member.returns: Blended compliance score (0-1).

member.summary: Gets a detailed breakdown of genre compliance for analysis.

member.summary: Detailed breakdown of genre compliance scoring.

member.summary: Detailed breakdown of genre compliance scoring.

member.summary: Overall compliance score (0-1).

member.summary: Score from obligatory scene satisfaction (0-1).

member.summary: Score from convention presence (0-1).

member.summary: Whether the core event occurred.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.GenreComplianceBreakdown.ValueSpectrumCoverage
member.summary: Coverage of the value spectrum (0-1).

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.GenreComplianceBreakdown.MissingObligatoryScenes
member.summary: Codes of unsatisfied obligatory scenes.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.GenreComplianceBreakdown.MissingConventions
member.summary: Codes of missing conventions.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.KernelIdentifier
member.summary:
Classifies events as Kernels (essential) or Satellites (elaboration). Based on Roland Barthes' "Introduction to the Structural Analysis of Narratives" (1966).
WEIGHT DERIVATION: These weights are design hypotheses based on: - Barthes' conceptual hierarchy (kernels = branching points) - Propp's phase ordering (later phases = higher stakes) - Configurable to allow empirical tuning via A/B testing.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.KernelIdentifier.Weights
member.summary: Hypothesis weights for kernel identification. Subject to empirical calibration.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.KernelIdentifier.Weights.ProppFunction
member.summary: Weight for Propp function satisfaction. Rationale: Functions define story grammar.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.KernelIdentifier.Weights.ObligatoryScene
member.summary: Weight for obligatory scene satisfaction. Rationale: Genre contracts with audience.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.KernelIdentifier.Weights.ValueChange
member.summary: Weight for value change magnitude. Rationale: McKee's definition of dramatic unit.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.KernelIdentifier.Weights.ConsequenceRatio
member.summary: Weight for consequence ratio. Rationale: Causal importance in plot structure.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.KernelIdentifier.DefaultThreshold
member.summary: Default threshold for kernel classification. Events scoring above this are kernels; below are satellites.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.KernelIdentifier.Calculate(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculate kernel score for an event.
member.param: The Propp phase if this event satisfies a function, null otherwise.
Whether this event fulfills a genre obligatory scene.
Fraction of story events that depend on this one (0-1).
member.returns: Kernel score (0-1). Higher scores indicate more essential events.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.KernelIdentifier.CalculateByFunctionCode(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculate kernel score using a Propp function code directly.
member.param: The Propp function code (e.g., "villainy", "victory"), or null.
Whether this event fulfills a genre obligatory scene.
Fraction of story events that depend on this one (0-1).
member.returns: Kernel score (0-1).

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.KernelIdentifier.IsKernel(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Determines if an event is a kernel based on its score.
member.returns: True if the event is a kernel, false if satellite.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.KernelIdentifier.Classify(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Classifies an event as kernel or satellite.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.KernelClassification
member.summary: Result of kernel classification.
member.param: Whether the event is classified as a kernel.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.KernelClassification.#ctor(System.Double,System.Boolean,BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.NarrativeUnitType)
member.summary: Result of kernel classification.
member.param: Whether the event is classified as a kernel.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.KernelClassification.Score
member.summary: The calculated kernel score (0-1).

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.KernelClassification.IsKernel
member.summary: Whether the event is classified as a kernel.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.KernelClassification.Type
member.summary: The narrative unit type.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.NarrativeUnitType
member.summary: Types of narrative units based on Barthes' classification.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.NarrativeUnitType.Kernel
member.summary: Essential event that cannot be removed without altering story logic. Represents branching points where choices occur.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.NarrativeUnitType.Satellite
member.summary: Elaboration and texture that can be freely modified or removed. Embellishes kernels without changing the fundamental story.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.NarrativePotentialScorer
member.summary:
Scores the narrative potential of a story state for GOAP planning. Higher potential indicates more promising states for action selection.
WEIGHT DERIVATION: These weights are design hypotheses based on: - Distance to goal is the primary GOAP heuristic - Available actions represent narrative flexibility - Unrevealed information creates engagement hooks - Urgency signals proximity to resolution Configurable to allow empirical tuning via A/B testing.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.NarrativePotentialScorer.Weights
member.summary: Hypothesis weights for narrative potential scoring. Subject to empirical calibration.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.NarrativePotentialScorer.Weights.GoalProgress
member.summary: Weight for progress toward goal state. Rationale: Primary GOAP heuristic - closer to goal is better.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.NarrativePotentialScorer.Weights.ActionAvailability
member.summary: Weight for available narrative actions. Rationale: More options = more narrative flexibility.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.NarrativePotentialScorer.Weights.TensionStakesAlignment
member.summary: Weight for tension-stakes alignment. Rationale: Misaligned tension/stakes feels wrong to audiences.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.NarrativePotentialScorer.Weights.MysteryEngagement
member.summary: Weight for mystery engagement. Rationale: Unrevealed information hooks engagement.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.NarrativePotentialScorer.Weights.UrgencyAppropriateness
member.summary: Weight for urgency appropriateness. Rationale: Urgency should match story phase.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.NarrativePotentialScorer.Thresholds
member.summary: Thresholds for alignment scoring.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.NarrativePotentialScorer.Thresholds.TensionStakesMaxDiff
member.summary: Maximum reasonable difference between tension and stakes. Beyond this, the story feels incoherent.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.NarrativePotentialScorer.Thresholds.MinEngagingMystery
member.summary: Minimum mystery needed for engagement (except at resolution).

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.NarrativePotentialScorer.Thresholds.MaxClearMystery
member.summary: Maximum mystery that maintains clarity.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.NarrativePotentialScorer.Calculate(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.State.NarrativeState,BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.State.NarrativeState,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculate narrative potential score.
member.param: Number of valid actions from this state.
Total actions in the action space.
member.returns: Potential score (0-1). Higher scores indicate more promising states.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.NarrativePotentialScorer.CalculateGoalProgress(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.State.NarrativeState,BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.State.NarrativeState)
member.summary: Calculate goal progress as inverse normalized distance.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.NarrativePotentialScorer.CalculateTensionStakesAlignment(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.State.NarrativeState)
member.summary: Calculate tension-stakes alignment. High tension with low stakes (or vice versa) feels wrong.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.NarrativePotentialScorer.CalculateMysteryEngagement(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.State.NarrativeState,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculate mystery engagement score. Mystery should decrease toward resolution but maintain engagement.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.NarrativePotentialScorer.CalculateUrgencyAppropriateness(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.State.NarrativeState,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculate urgency appropriateness for the story phase. Urgency should generally increase toward the climax.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.NarrativePotentialScorer.GoapHeuristic(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.State.NarrativeState,BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.State.NarrativeState)
member.summary: GOAP heuristic function for A* planning. Returns estimated cost to reach goal from current state.
member.returns: Estimated cost (lower is closer to goal).

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.NarrativePotentialScorer.EvaluateTransition(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.State.NarrativeState,BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.State.NarrativeState,BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.State.NarrativeState)
member.summary: Evaluates whether a state transition moves toward the goal. Useful for GOAP action evaluation.
member.returns: Positive if moving toward goal, negative if moving away.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.NarrativePotentialScorer.GetBreakdown(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.State.NarrativeState,BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.State.NarrativeState,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double)

member.summary: Suggests state adjustments to improve narrative potential.

member.summary: Detailed breakdown of narrative potential scoring.

member.summary: Detailed breakdown of narrative potential scoring.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.PacingSatisfactionScorer
member.summary:
Scores story pacing against beat sheet timing expectations. Based on Blake Snyder's Save the Cat methodology (2005).
WEIGHT DERIVATION: These weights are design hypotheses based on: - Critical beats (Catalyst, Midpoint, All Is Lost) are structural pillars - Order violations create narrative confusion - Timing drift accumulates but early beats set expectations Configurable to allow empirical tuning via A/B testing.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.PacingSatisfactionScorer.Weights
member.summary: Hypothesis weights for pacing satisfaction scoring. Subject to empirical calibration.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.PacingSatisfactionScorer.Weights.CriticalBeatTiming
member.summary: Weight for critical beat timing accuracy. Rationale: Critical beats are the structural pillars of the story.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.PacingSatisfactionScorer.Weights.BeatOrder
member.summary: Weight for beat order correctness. Rationale: Out-of-order beats confuse the narrative flow.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.PacingSatisfactionScorer.Weights.OverallTiming
member.summary: Weight for overall timing drift. Rationale: Cumulative timing errors indicate pacing problems.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.PacingSatisfactionScorer.Weights.BeatCoverage
member.summary: Weight for beat coverage (are all beats present?). Rationale: Missing beats create structural gaps.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.PacingSatisfactionScorer.DefaultTimingStrategy
member.summary: Timing strategy for beat percentage targets.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.PacingSatisfactionScorer.Calculate(System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{System.ValueTuple{System.String,System.Double}},System.String)
member.summary: Calculate pacing satisfaction score.
member.param: List of (beat code, actual position 0-1) in occurrence order.
Timing strategy: "bs2" for screenplay, "fiction" for novels.
member.returns: Pacing satisfaction score (0-1). Higher scores indicate better pacing.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.PacingSatisfactionScorer.CalculateCriticalBeatTiming(System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{System.ValueTuple{System.String,System.Double}},System.String)
member.summary: Calculate timing accuracy for critical beats only.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.PacingSatisfactionScorer.CalculateBeatOrderScore(System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{System.ValueTuple{System.String,System.Double}})
member.summary: Calculate beat order correctness. Returns 1.0 if beats are in correct order, decreases with inversions.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.PacingSatisfactionScorer.CalculateOverallTimingScore(System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{System.ValueTuple{System.String,System.Double}},System.String)
member.summary: Calculate overall timing drift across all beats.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.PacingSatisfactionScorer.CalculateBeatCoverageScore(System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{System.ValueTuple{System.String,System.Double}})
member.summary: Calculate beat coverage score.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.PacingSatisfactionScorer.GetBreakdown(System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{System.ValueTuple{System.String,System.Double}},System.String)
member.summary: Gets a detailed breakdown of pacing for analysis.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Scoring.PacingSatisfactionScorer.SuggestNextBeat(System.Double,System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyCollection{System.String},System.String)
member.summary: Suggests the next beat based on current story position.
member.returns: The recommended next beat, or null if story is complete.

member.summary: Timing analysis for a single beat occurrence.
member.param: Where the beat should ideally occur (0-1).
Difference from target (can be negative for early, positive for late).
Whether the beat is within acceptable timing range.
Whether this is a critical structural beat.

member.summary: The beat's code.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.State.NarrativeState
member.summary: Six-dimensional narrative state space for story beat tracking. Parallel to EmotionalState in music-storyteller SDK. All dimensions normalized 0.0 to 1.0.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.State.NarrativeState.Tension
member.summary: Conflict intensity. 0 = resolved/peaceful, 1 = climactic confrontation. Maps to: unresolved conflicts, active threats, confrontation proximity.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.State.NarrativeState.Stakes
member.summary: What's at risk. 0 = trivial consequences, 1 = existential/irreversible. Maps to: life/death, love/loss, honor/shame magnitude.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.State.NarrativeState.Mystery
member.summary: Unanswered questions. 0 = everything clear, 1 = deep enigma. Maps to: hidden information, unrevealed secrets, unclear motivations.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.State.NarrativeState.Urgency
member.summary: Time pressure. 0 = leisurely/no deadline, 1 = desperate/immediate. Maps to: countdown timers, approaching threats, windows closing.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.State.NarrativeState.Intimacy
member.summary: Character emotional closeness. 0 = strangers/enemies, 1 = deeply bonded. Maps to: relationship depth, trust levels, shared history.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.State.NarrativeState.Hope
member.summary: Expected outcome valence. 0 = despair/doom, 1 = hope/triumph. Maps to: protagonist advantage, resource availability, ally support.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.State.NarrativeState.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new narrative state with default equilibrium values.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.State.NarrativeState.#ctor(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a new narrative state with specified values.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.State.NarrativeState.DistanceTo(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.State.NarrativeState)
member.summary: Calculates the Euclidean distance to another narrative state. Useful for GOAP heuristics and measuring how far current state is from target.
member.returns: Distance in the range [0, sqrt(6)] (~2.45 max).

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.State.NarrativeState.NormalizedDistanceTo(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.State.NarrativeState)
member.summary: Calculates the normalized distance (0-1) to another narrative state.
member.returns: Normalized distance from 0 (identical) to 1 (maximum difference).

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.State.NarrativeState.InterpolateTo(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.State.NarrativeState,System.Double)
member.summary: Linearly interpolates between this state and a target state.
member.param: The target state to interpolate towards.
Interpolation factor from 0 (this state) to 1 (target state).
member.returns: A new interpolated narrative state.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.State.NarrativeState.ApplyDelta(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.State.NarrativeState)
member.summary: Applies a delta change to all dimensions. Delta values are centered at 0.5 (no change), so 0.7 adds 0.2, 0.3 subtracts 0.2.
member.param: The delta state containing changes to apply.
member.returns: A new state with the delta applied.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.State.NarrativeState.Clone
member.summary: Creates a deep copy of this narrative state.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.State.NarrativeState.Equilibrium
member.summary: Gets the equilibrium preset (convenience shorthand).

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.State.NarrativeState.Presets
member.summary: Common narrative state presets.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.State.NarrativeState.Presets.Equilibrium
member.summary: Stable starting point.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.State.NarrativeState.Presets.RisingAction
member.summary: Building toward climax.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.State.NarrativeState.Presets.Climax
member.summary: Maximum tension climax point.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.State.NarrativeState.Presets.Resolution
member.summary: Resolution after climax.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.State.NarrativeState.Presets.Tragedy
member.summary: Tragic ending.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.State.NarrativeState.Presets.MysteryHook
member.summary: Mystery opening with high intrigue.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.State.NarrativeState.Presets.DarkestHour
member.summary: All Is Lost moment (Save the Cat).

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.State.NarrativeState.Presets.HeroAtMercy
member.summary: Hero at Mercy of Villain (Story Grid).

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Structure.SaveTheCatBeats
member.summary: Blake Snyder's Save the Cat beat sheet with timing percentages. Based on "Save the Cat!" (2005) and "Save the Cat! Writes a Novel" (2018).

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Structure.SaveTheCatBeats.OpeningImage
member.summary: Opening Image - Visual snapshot of the hero's "before" world.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Structure.SaveTheCatBeats.ThemeStated
member.summary: Theme Stated - The story's deeper truth is articulated.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Structure.SaveTheCatBeats.SetUp
member.summary: Set-Up - World, flaws, and supporting cast established.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Structure.SaveTheCatBeats.Catalyst
member.summary: Catalyst - The inciting incident that disrupts the status quo.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Structure.SaveTheCatBeats.Debate
member.summary: Debate - Hero questions whether to take the journey.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Structure.SaveTheCatBeats.BreakIntoTwo
member.summary: Break into Two - Hero commits to the journey.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Structure.SaveTheCatBeats.BStory
member.summary: B Story - Secondary story begins (often a love story).

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Structure.SaveTheCatBeats.FunAndGames
member.summary: Fun and Games - The "promise of the premise" is delivered.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Structure.SaveTheCatBeats.Midpoint
member.summary: Midpoint - Major shift with false victory or false defeat.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Structure.SaveTheCatBeats.BadGuysCloseIn
member.summary: Bad Guys Close In - External pressures and internal doubts mount.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Structure.SaveTheCatBeats.AllIsLost
member.summary: All Is Lost - The lowest point with a "whiff of death."

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Structure.SaveTheCatBeats.DarkNightOfSoul
member.summary: Dark Night of the Soul - Hero reflects in despair.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Structure.SaveTheCatBeats.BreakIntoThree
member.summary: Break into Three - Epiphany sparks renewed resolve.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Structure.SaveTheCatBeats.Finale
member.summary: Finale - Hero applies what they've learned.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Structure.SaveTheCatBeats.FinalImage
member.summary: Final Image - Visual "after" showing transformation.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Structure.SaveTheCatBeats.All
member.summary: All Save the Cat beats in order.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Structure.SaveTheCatBeats.GetByCode(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a beat by its code.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Structure.SaveTheCatBeats.GetByAct(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets all beats for a specific act.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Structure.SaveTheCatBeats.GetTargetPosition(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets the target position for a beat using the specified strategy.
member.returns: Target position as percentage (0-1).

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Structure.SaveTheCatBeats.CriticalBeats
member.summary: Critical beats that are most important for story structure.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Structure.SaveTheCatBeat
member.summary: Represents a single Save the Cat beat.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Structure.SaveTheCatBeat.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Nullable{System.Double})
member.summary: Represents a single Save the Cat beat.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Structure.SaveTheCatBeat.GetTargetPosition(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the target position for this beat using the specified strategy.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Structure.SaveTheCatBeat.IsPositionAcceptable(System.Double,System.String)
member.summary: Checks if a position is within the acceptable range for this beat.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Structure.SaveTheCatBeat.IsCritical
member.summary: Gets whether this beat is considered critical for story structure.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Structure.MidpointType
member.summary: Midpoint types per Save the Cat methodology.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Structure.MidpointType.FalseVictory
member.summary: Hero seems to achieve goal but hasn't truly.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Structure.MidpointType.FalseDefeat
member.summary: Appears all is lost but isn't; often raises stakes.
